comment.author: 92577060@N05
comment._content: The word "Cosoyieran" should possibly be "Presbyterian".  There are several references to this church in newspapers at the time including references to it being a Presbyterian Church, established Church of Scotland.  Many years later it became the Uniting Church and still exists today [2013].

comment.author: 21966852@N06
comment._content: ‘is notable as being the first memorial of her late Majesty Queen Victoria. It was built by the Presbyterians, the foundation stone was laid by Mrs Ben, on 24th March, 1900, and it was dedicated by the Rev Geo. Tait, Moderator of the General Assembly on 29th January, 1901. a few days after the death of the Queen.’ (see full details below) (Extract from the Yea Chronicle on Thursday 20 July 1911) trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/59675426#pstart5944064

comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: Thanks for your comments. The caption for this image does indeed say Presbyterian. I have updated the description accordingly.
